message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.MM, cs.RO, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with image processing and computer vision techniques for line segment extraction, which are typically covered in the computer vision (cs.CV) and graphics (cs.GR) sub-categories. The use of filters and statistical tests for edge detection and segmentation also suggests a possible fit with the multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of the Hough Transform, which is a common technique in robotics (cs.RO) for line detection in sensor data. Finally, the paper proposes a new method for line segment extraction that combines contextual and local edges, which could be of interest to researchers in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) working on image understanding and object recognition.
